data.title: Instant aiming
data.body:
Soldiers aim and shoot instantly (even if they spot an enemy in their back), giving a faster gameplay and allowing some hit & run (attack-move) moves.
Unfortunately vehicles must rotate their turret or rotate themselves to aim. 
Suppose I spot a hijacker in one or two cells behind my mammoth tank, whatever I do the mammoth tank will be lost because it rotates too slowly to target the hijacker (and it can kill the hijacker by shooting at him only one time !). 

![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4425010/118fe116-45a5-11e4-9513-cadb38d29085.png)

Same scenarios with helicopters shot down by bazookas in their back, arties shot down because they rotate too slowly to flee, submarines sunk by submarines in their back, and so on …

Is it possible to include an option which allows to remove all types of vehicle rotations to have an instant aiming and therefore faster and more brutal games (I imagine that there would be a simple condition to skip rotations/animations in the code) ?

There would be no need to "pre place" vehicles anymore (to “pre target” a potential enemy), no delay between detection and shooting, no players prevailing over other players simply because the vehicles look somewhere, and the gameplay would be closer to e-sports games.

data.title: Unhardcoded productionbar colors
data.body:
Added an expample color to the defense production bar as well
(see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5454#issuecomment-44159648 ).

data.title: Add support for time-limited actor upgrades.
data.body:
- Add new upgrade features:
  - Added support for time-limited upgrades and other bookkeeping via the `UpgradeManager` trait.
  - `GrantUpgradePower` allows support powers to give temporary or permanent upgrades.
  - `GrantUpgradeWarhead` allows warheads to give temporary or permanent upgrades.
- Rewrite the Iron Curtain:
  - Uses  `GrantUpgradePower` with the `UpgradeOverlay` and `InvulnerabilityUpgrade` traits instead of custom RA-specific code.
  - Added an invulnerability crate that triggers the same temporary upgrade via a crate.
  - Demolition trucks now explode when iron curtained.
- Other:
  - Replaced `RemoveOnConditions` → `KillsSelf` to take better advantage of the upgrades code.
  - Fixed issues with time-limited cloak upgrades.
  - Renamed `UnitUpgradeCrateAction` → `GrantUpgradeCrateAction` to be consistent with the other upgrade sources.
  - Added EMP plumbing to TS.

data.title: Fix server freeze on client absence.
data.body:
The server has no concept of clients disconnecting due to networking faults or purposely pulling their internet connection. The current behavior is the server freezes forever waiting for the missing clients to respond until the game timeouts.

This is incredibly frustrating for free-for-all and to an extent, larger team games. More often than not players wish to continue. This fixes the bug by recognizing that clients aren't communicating and eventually drops them so the game can continue.

First the server responds to say it's still alive and waiting, then after a while it shows who isn't responding. Finally after 2 minutes it drops the players. I recommend at least 1.5 minutes before dropping players as often a router can be restarted within a minute and in the original games often found you'd missed the 60 second deadline only by a few seconds.

This is an important fix as the majority of games going down on hetzner, etc. are because of this.

data.title: Brought back damage per second export again
data.body:
A revised version of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5451 which does the calculation internally as requested to avoid making this useful to spreadsheet users only. It has been designed with more flexibility implementation wise to allow other output formats in the future.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/4348962/2d6cc6a2-41a3-11e4-9fc8-2e7798142c44.png)

data.title: Update Gentoo ebuild for Lua5.1.5
data.body:
``` diff
--- 1/configure 2014-06-01 15:26:29.000000000 +0400
+++ 2/configure 2014-06-01 16:26:16.951029584 +0400
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
os=`uname`
if [ "$os" == 'Linux' ]; then
locations=(/usr/lib /usr/lib64 /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu /usr/local/lib /opt/lib)
- sonames=(liblua5.1.so.5.1 liblua5.1.so.0 liblua.so.5.1 liblua-5.1.so liblua5.1.so)
+ sonames=(liblua.so.5.1.5 liblua5.1.so.5.1 liblua5.1.so.0 liblua.so.5.1 liblua-5.1.so liblua5.1.so)
for location in "${locations[@]}" ; do
for soname in ${sonames[@]} ; do
if [ -f $location/$soname ]; then
```

data.title: Cell Debug Overlay
data.body:
Closes #5741 if merged.
This makes fine-tuning sequence offsets by multiples of 6 (which is very fine, 12 is better to start with) much easier.

Original message:

> This points out a possible flaw in our cell coordinates/offsets wrt TS (diamonds).
> Buildings and units are on different cell grids (mismatched by 0.5 cells).
> Meaning buildings operate on a shifted grid (+/-)512 on x and y.
> This is fine for mods that use rectangle (square) cells but turns things ugly for diamond TileShapes.
> Main visual case is TS subcells vs structure foundation

In fact the error is all on the art side of things.

New dev commands:

```
/grid
/grid above
/grid below
/grid full
/grid half
/grid type
/grid range <integer>
/grid reset
```

data.title: actor.IsInWorld and actor.IsDead checks are throwing "actor is not in world" exceptions
data.body:
**Code**:
`WorldLoaded = function() Trigger.OnKilled(actor1, function() Trigger.AfterDelay(25, function() if actor2 and actor2.IsDead then Media.DisplayMessage("test") end end) end)
end`
(Same happens when I use `IsInWorld` instead of `IsDead`)

**Picture**:
![strangelua](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/4348703/edcda56c-4197-11e4-8715-cb163c8e2972.png)

I destroyed the oil barrels and got this
**Exception**:
`[string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Uncaught CLR exception at Lua->CLR boundary: System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Ein Aufrufziel hat einen Ausnahmefehler verursacht. ---> System.InvalidOperationException: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (actor 2 (not in world))`
(https://translate.google.com/ says that "Ein Aufrufziel hat einen Ausnahmefehler verursacht." means "Target of an invocation has generated an exception.")

data.title: Lua 5.1 library detection failed on Gentoo and derivatives
data.body:
Hi there,

I'm running Sabayon and wanted to install OpenRA.
I've installed all the dependencies, including lua51. Unfortunately then I tried to configure (./configure) I got the error:
Lua 5.1 library detection failed.

But I do have lua 5.1 installed.

Any idea how to solve it?

Thank you!
